Description: Mould-made pottery plastic handle broken from the rear of a lamp, decorated with Sarapis enthroned, holding a sceptre, with Kerberos by his side. At the rear is impressed a panel of walling, with firing-slits cut through it. Part of the lamp body survives. At the rear is the upper spring of an applied loop handle. Covered with a pale orange slip. Cream Egyptian marl fabric, with fine organic inclusions.
Curator's comments: Parallels in Alexandria (Breccia 1924, 1-2, pl.20), and published (Cahn-Klaiber 1977, 226; Hornbostel 1973, pl.146, 237; Mogensen 1930, pl. 36, A 202; Neugebauer, K. A. et al. 1938, pl. 54, 131). In collections in New York from Meydum (MMANY 06.1232.86) and in the Benaki collection, Arthens (NAM no.MП 766-7). See Bailey (1988, 245). Breccia, E. 1924, Le Musée Gréco-Romaine 1922-23. Alexandria. Cahn-Klaiber, E. M. 1977. Die antiken Tonlampen der Archäologischen Instituts der Universität, Tϋbingen. Hornbostel, W. 1973. Sarapis, Leiden. Mogensen, M. 1930. La Glyptothèque Ny Carlsberg, La Collection Egyptienne, Copenhagen. Neugebauer, K. A. et al. 1938. Antiken in deutschem privatbesitz, Berlin.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q.03)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.14) (Phase 1)
